meanings.definition: To make a speech or deliver an address.
meanings.sent1: During the school assembly, the principal will speechify about the importance of kindness.
meanings.sent2: The politician will speechify at the rally to share their plans for the community.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to speechify to the birds outside, hoping they would listen.
meanings.sent4: The waves speechify to the shore, telling tales of distant lands.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's words speechify in the students' minds, inspiring them to learn.

meanings.definition: To speak in a pompous or grandiloquent manner.
meanings.sent1: The professor likes to speechify during lectures, using big words to impress the students.
meanings.sent2: The king would speechify to his subjects, making grand promises of prosperity.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to speechify to the other animals, but they found it amusing.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm speechifies loudly, demanding attention from all who hear it.
meanings.sent5: The actor's performance speechifies the emotions of the character, captivating the audience.
